boardgame.name: Alesia
Caesar at Alesia
Caesar: Epic Battle of Alesia
boardgame.description: Caesar at Alesia simulates an epic battle in 52 BC where Julius Caesar surrounded the battered forces of the Gauls led by Vercingetorix. Knowing the Gauls had a relief force coming (of over 250,000 men), Caesar built a defensive perimeter facing outward to match his perimeter facing inward to beseige Vercingetorix. An unusual _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;donut_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; formation._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The large mapboard 33_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;x28_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; portrays the town of Alesia and all of the works built by Caesar. The Gauls have a small force trapped in the town including Vercingetorix as well as a large force which sets up in off board areas. The Gallic player must reveal which off board zones he occupies with at least 1 unit, but does NOT have give further information._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The goal of the game is for the Gauls to create an escape route for Vercingetorix and exit him off the board. The Romans must prevent this over the 20 game turns (which represents 2 days)._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

CONDITION: Like New, contents near mint, unused and complete, with unpunched counters. The box is near perfect also. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m listing it as Very Good only because the rulebook has slight handling wear and a small mark on the back cover. POSTAGE COST: UK postage: £5.50 European Postage: £12.00 Rest of World Postage: £23.00 Any buyers in and around London are welcome to collect in person (cash on collection). COMBINED SHIPPING: I will always combine multiple items to reduce your shipping costs where possible. Please note that it is NOT always cheaper to combine shipping on games outside the UK due to the weight limit of 2KG on the Small Packet service. As a rough approximation, outside the UK it is usually cheaper to combine 5 or more games, while 4 or less are best sent individually. This depends entirely on the specific games - please contact me before buying if you wish to purchase multiple games so that I can give you an accurate shipping cost. ABOUT ME: I have been playing and collecting games for over 25 years and I also sell games and magazines on ebay with the same username (saabdastard) where I have a 100% positive rating and a feedback score of over 4000. I am a verified PAYPAL Premier account holder (since 2004), with over 650 PayPal Verified Buyers. SELLERS TERMS AND CONDITIONS: PAYMENT TERMS: Please wait until you receive my invoice before sending payment. Payment is due within 5 days of the date you receive my invoice. Please do not purchase if you do not intend to pay, or cannot pay within this time frame. PAYMENT METHODS: UK buyers may use PayPal, cheque or cash-on-collection. Overseas buyers MUST USE PAYPAL only. SHIPPING: Buyer is responsible for all shipping costs. Europe and Rest of World rates shown above are for Airmail. Surface Mail rate to Rest of World is available if you wish (same as Europe Air rate), but Surface Mail to Rest of World can take up to 2 months! There is no real difference between Air and Surface rates for Europe. INSURANCE: Insurance is optional on all items, unless noted. Failure to take out optional insurance limits my liability for loss or damage in the mail to the amount automatically covered by Royal Mail (currently £39 per package for Small Packets, £150 for International Standard). CUSTOMS: Buyers outside the EU are responsible for all Customs charges applicable to their country. RETURNS: New Unopened items may be returned for a refund of the purchase price of the item, excluding shipping charges, within 7 days of the delivery date. All returned items must be in the original packaging and in the condition that they were shipped to you. Defective or damaged items can be returned for an exchange or refund within 7 days of the delivery date. All returns require authorization from me BEFORE returning the item.

· CAESAR: Epic Battle Of Alesia (Avalon Hill, 1976) The game is in EXCELLENT condition, the box shows some shelf wear. The counters are PUNCHED and the game is verified COMPLETE. Buyer pays for shipping. Cashiers Check and Money Orders accepted, PAY PAL preferred. Payment is expected to arrive and clear before games will ship. Additional pictures furnished upon request. Best wishes, Jon ZIP CODE: 07801 greatdiscoverer@yahoo.com

In 51 B.C., Vercingetorix led 80,000 starving Gauls from the besieged city of Alesia and threw them against the surrounding Roman fortifications in concert with attacks from without by a relieving force a quarter of a million strong. What followed sealed the fate of Gaul. Can you succeed where he failed? Julius Caesar with ten tested legions maintained an investment of a force larger than his own while fending off a relieving force 250,000 strong. Outnumbered 6-1, defending a tactical _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;doughnut_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; against a simultaneously expanding center and contracting perimeter, Caesar accomplished a feat which astounds historians to this day. Caesar recreates on a large 28_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; x 33_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;, full colour mapboard the epic battle of Alesia, unique in antiquity and all of recorded warfare, in highly playable classic form in a game as exciting as the battle itself. Complete and in excellent condition.

This is an unpunched copy. In addition there is a bag of counters from another copy I used to have which has long since gone, essentially 2 sets of counters. The bagged set is missing one piece which has been replaced with a home-made counter. The game is in excellent condition, the box has some shelf wear but is in excellent condition for age, no split corners etc... The game is 100% complete. Will post Worldwide and accept Paypal.

Punched, bagged and sorted but with issues: Rulebook is a photocopy Counters are verified as complete but there are four substitute counters: 2 Barbarian, 1 Roman, 1 Fort. There are more fort counters than you likely need so no playability issue there. Substitute unit counters are scanned and Photoshopped so look just like the originals. The map is in mint condition except panel 3 (of three) has encountered some water on one edge. It_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s about two inches in. Fully legible and undamaged but paper a little wrinkly. Basically a fine playable copy but not for the collector or purist. Also good if you want parts. The substitute unit counters are: Roman XV-2 Barbarian Pictones (7-6) unit 3 Barbarian Andi (5-6) unit 2 and a generic Fort counter Still, more fun than clunky GMT version. Priority mail to any U.S. address is $9

It comes with some prints from General magazine about the game. INTERNATIONAL BUYERS - The shipment charges are based on shipping a parcel by International Guaranted Mail with tracking number. The costs depend both on the zone you live AND the weight of the parcel. I am considering 3 different ranges of weight (from 250 to 350 grammes/ from 350 grammes to 1 kilo/ from 1 kilo to 2 kilos). Most of the games are in the 350 - 1 kilo range. In the case the parcel would weight more than 2 kilos (as in a case of a combined shipment) I ll have to ship it by another mean (i.e. QPE or EMS) and have to recalculate the costs. Anyway for any doubt or questions, please, feel free to ask in advance. I am also glad to upload more pictures if needed. Europe and some African countries : 10,60/ 14,40 / 21,10 euro. US, Canada, other countries of America and Africa: 13,90/ 20,00 / 29,90 euro. Oceania : 17,80/ 26,70 / 37,80 euro. In the case of a miscalculation in your favor I ll refund any eventual surplus charge.

Contents are in very good condition except rule booklet shows wear along spine. Game was missing 2 counters; 1 of 20 white counters with the word “Disrupt” on them and 1 of 15 pink counters with a horse head and 2-15 printed on it representing the First Squadron of Caesars mercenary Germanic Cavalry. I made replacement counters by copying existing counters of the same type. See pictures. Counters have been verified by reference to pictures of unpunched panels on BGG. The box top has one split corner and tape remnants on all four sides (See picture). The box bottom is intact with slight rough spots where tape was removed. I will ship USPS Priority Mail with cost based on destination, weight and box dimensions. For this game box is 15.5 x 12.5 x 3.25 inches. Weight is 3 lbs, 6 oz. You can calculate shipping charges on USPS website (www.usps.com) based on your Zip Code and my Zip Code, 95829. I will confirm shipping charges when I know destination. Local pickup is also acceptable.
Unpunched, Updated replacement counters (unpunched) are included, Essentials CD included PayPal or US Postal Money Order Other methods of payment may be accepted but contact me before ordering.
